articles.title: Supreme Court clarifies when share substitution on amalgamations is taxable under S. 28 Income Tax Act
articles.summary: Business profits must be concrete and commercially realisable, not mere paper adjustments. In amalgamation, substitution of shares that yield realisable assets of definite value constitutes taxable income under Section 28 of Income Tax Act, 1961, guided by the doctrine of real income to tax genuine gains while avoiding illusory ones. The post Supreme Court clarifies when share substitution on amalgamations is taxable under S. 28 Income Tax Act appeared first on SCC Times .

articles.summary: Union Budget of India: The upcoming Union Budget in 2026 is expected to prioritize fiscal prudence over populism, focusing on expenditure management and consolidation. The budget will likely maintain continuity in tax structures, with potential adjustments to customs tariffs influenced by global trade dynamics.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Date and time of historic Sunday presentation by Nirmala Sitharaman
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026 date time: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget 2026–27 on February 1 at 11 am, her ninth budget in Parliament. As the presentation falls on a Sunday, BSE and NSE will keep equity markets open, with pre-open trade from 9 am to 9:08 am and normal trading from 9:15 am to 3:30 pm.

articles.title: Budget 2026 may be another step towards manufacturing 'atmanirbharta' for a power shift

The upcoming budget is expected to prioritize manufacturing, addressing challenges like labor reforms and infrastructure to boost the sector's contribution to GVA. Support for MSMEs facing U.S. tariff headwinds and accelerating ease of doing business initiatives are also anticipated.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India’s power shift hinges on fixing a crisis millions complain about
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget on February 1, with jobs expected to be a central focus. India currently has a demographic advantage, with more working-age people than dependents, but translating this into steady employment is critical for the nation’s economic and global ambitions.

articles.title: Centre likely to prioritise debt consolidation, capex push in Budget 2026: ICRA
articles.summary: The upcoming Union Budget for 2026-27 is expected to prioritize medium-term debt consolidation while maintaining a strong push for capital expenditure. ICRA projects a fiscal deficit of 4.3% of GDP, with a significant increase in capital spending to Rs 13.1 trillion, aiming to front-load infrastructure development before future fiscal rigidities.

These premium trains operate on a 100% confirmed berth policy, unlike regular trains.

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya

CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares

This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game

Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. articles.summary: India's first Vande Bharat sleeper train, designed for faster overnight travel, faced immediate criticism after a video emerged showing litter scattered across a coach shortly after its inaugural run. The incident sparked widespread social media commentary on the lack of civic sense among some passengers.

articles.summary: Indian-American astronaut Sunita Williams, a record-holder for spacewalking, shared her experiences at the American Center in Delhi. She spoke about her recent extended stay on the ISS, the challenges faced, and the growing commercialization of space. Williams also highlighted the importance of international cooperation in space exploration and inspired Indian students to pursue careers in the sector.

articles.title: CAT quashes CBIC charges against Sameer Wankhede
articles.summary: The Central Administrative Tribunal has cleared IRS officer Sameer Wankhede of disciplinary charges. The tribunal found the charges framed by the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs to be retaliatory. It observed that the action appeared to be an attempt to stall Wankhede's promotion.

articles.title: Vinod Tawde to be BJP's Kerala poll in-charge
Congress slams BJP: You pick president first, then say there’s a poll
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's use of the term 'urban Naxals' has drawn sharp criticism from the Congress party. The Congress pointed out that the Home Ministry itself does not use this phrase. They questioned if the Prime Minister considers anyone opposing him an 'urban Naxal'.

articles.title: Rule change: Lok Sabha MPs can mark attendance only from their seats
articles.summary: Lok Sabha MPs must now mark attendance from their designated seats during functioning hours, a change effective from the upcoming Budget session. Speaker Om Birla announced this reform to ensure attendance reflects active participation, not just presence within Parliament. This move aims to boost discipline and productivity in legislative proceedings.

articles.title: On Day 1, Nitin Nabin targets rivals in poll-bound TN
articles.summary: Nitin Nabin, in his first address as BJP national president, urged party workers to defend Sanatan faith and its legacy, stating that parties opposing traditions like 'deepam' in Madurai or Ram Setu have no place in politics. He also encouraged youth to actively participate in politics, viewing it as a long-term commitment.

articles.title: Police summonses to journos a 'new low', say J&K parties
articles.summary: Political parties have strongly criticized police actions against Kashmiri journalists. They describe the summoning of reporters and demands for bonds as a "new low" and an attempt to intimidate and silence independent voices. This comes amid reports of journalists being questioned for their coverage of sensitive issues in the region. The actions are seen as a threat to press freedom.

articles.title: EC in SC: Art 324 needs to be read as including power of SIR

Government advises kin of Indian officials in Bangladesh to return
articles.summary: In response to escalating anti-India protests and potential violence in Bangladesh, India has advised families of its diplomats and officials stationed there to return home. This precautionary measure aims to ensure safety, though all Indian missions and posts in Bangladesh remain fully operational. The situation is temporary and will be reassessed.

articles.title: Monkey pox strain links Kerala cases to foreign travel: Study
articles.summary: A groundbreaking genetic study in Kerala has identified a more aggressive Mpox variant, Clade Ib, linked to international travel and ongoing human-to-human spread. Researchers found distinct mutations indicating the virus is evolving and adapting, suggesting faster transmission than older strains. This discovery underscores the urgent need for heightened surveillance and public health preparedness across India.

articles.title: A new low for rupee! Currency falls 23 paise in early trade; reaches 91.20 against US dollar
articles.summary: The Indian rupee hit a new low of 91.20 against the US dollar on Wednesday, extending its downward trend. This depreciation is attributed to strong dollar demand from metal importers, continued foreign fund outflows, and geopolitical uncertainties. The domestic stock market's sluggish performance also contributed to the rupee's decline.

articles.title: Budget 2026 expectations: Next phase of financial growth is affordable, smarter credit - here's why
articles.summary: Budget 2026 expectations: India does not need a larger financial system. It needs a system where liquidity is deeper.

articles.title: India in Davos: Union minister rules out trade talks at WEF; assures New Delhi's engagement on other fronts
articles.summary: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw clarified that the World Economic Forum in Davos serves as a platform for idea exchange, not formal trade negotiations. India is actively engaged with global economies on various fronts, and its economic growth and renewable energy initiatives are key discussion points at the event.

articles.title: Gold tops 1.5L/10gm, silver above Rs 3L/kg
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices surged to record highs on Tuesday, both domestically and internationally. This surge was attributed to an uncertain political and economic climate, a weaker dollar, and increasing industrial demand for silver. Analysts suggest that potential interest rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve could further fuel this upward trend in bullion prices.

articles.title: Rupee feels geopolitical heat, breaches 91 level against $
articles.summary: The Indian rupee dipped to a one-month low against the dollar on Tuesday, closing at 90.98. This marks the fifth consecutive session of weakening, fueled by escalating geopolitical tensions and a downturn in domestic equity markets. Despite efforts to prevent a record low, persistent dollar demand and global uncertainty continue to pressure the currency.

articles.title: EPFO's equity market exposure reaches 10%
Hyderabad-based AM group commits $25bn for AI infra hub in Noida
Core sector growth rises to 4-mth high
Nick Fuentes and Andrew Tate controversy grows after Miami nightclub Vendome fires three employees over viral party backlash
articles.summary: Miami nightclub Vendôme fired three employees after viral videos linked to Andrew Tate, Tristan Tate, Sneako, and Nick Fuentes sparked backlash. The club banned those involved and said it does not support hate of any kind. The Tate brothers denied singing or supporting the offensive content, according to TMZ and their lawyer.

articles.title: Candace Owens shares new conspiracy theory blaming Mikey McCoy’s wife for Erika Kirk’s struggles at TPUSA
articles.summary: Candace Owens shared a conspiracy theory claiming Elizabeth McCoy may be giving Erika Kirk bad advice at Turning Point USA. She compared the situation to Mean Girls and said the mistakes looked planned. Owens also criticized TPUSA for sending a legal letter to YouTuber Zack Gregorio, saying the move would only backfire.

articles.title: India's central bank proposes linking BRICS' digital currencies
articles.summary: India will host the summit, which will be held later this year. If ‌the recommendation is accepted, ‌a proposal to link the digital currencies of BRICS members would be put forward for the first time. The RBI's proposal builds ​on a 2025 declaration at a BRICS summit in Rio de Janeiro, which pushed for interoperability between members' payment systems ​to make cross-border transactions more efficient.

articles.title: US Commerce Secretary warns some Korean, Taiwanese firms may face 100% chip tariffs unless they invest in US
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick warned South Korean and Taiwanese chipmakers of 100% tariffs unless they expand manufacturing in America. The Trump administration is using trade deals and tariff threats to push investment, while temporarily pausing broad semiconductor levies. Micron’s vast US expansion underlines the approach as Samsung and SK Hynix weigh responses.

articles.title: NITI Aayog reports on government's women safety schemes should be public: CIC
articles.summary: The Central Information Commission has directed that NITI Aayog's evaluation reports on women safety schemes must be publicly accessible. These independent assessments evaluate scheme implementation and effectiveness. In a related directive, the Ministry of Women and Child Development is advised to proactively disclose contract details on its website.

articles.title: Budget 2026: FinMin shares status of key direct tax reforms for investors, startups and aam aadmi
articles.summary: India's government has finalized key direct tax reforms to boost investment and simplify compliance. Measures include clarified taxation for Alternative Investment Funds, extended startup tax holidays, and incentives for electronics manufacturing. Individual savers benefit from enhanced National Savings Scheme and NPS Vatsalya provisions, alongside property tax relief.

articles.title: India may give a $1 billion relief to footwear industry to cushion against 50% Trump tariffs: Report
articles.summary: India is preparing a significant financial package to bolster its footwear industry. This initiative aims to strengthen the entire production chain, from raw materials to finished goods. The move comes as the sector faces challenges from US tariffs and seeks to enhance domestic production and exports.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal meets US Ambassador Sergio Gor, Senator Steve Daines; discusses bilateral issues
articles.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal met with US Ambassador Sergio Gor and Senator Steve Daines to discuss bilateral issues, including ongoing trade agreement negotiations. The discussions come amidst a 50% US import duty on Indian goods and US senators' calls for favorable provisions for American pulse crop producers in any future trade deal.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP growth of 7.3% to boost average household income, insurance demand: Moody’s
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow by 7.3 per cent in FY 2025. This robust expansion will boost household incomes and drive demand for insurance. The insurance sector anticipates sustained premium growth due to economic strength, digitisation, and planned reforms. Increased risk awareness and easier product access are also contributing factors.

articles.title: RBI proposes linking BRICS' digital currencies, sources say
articles.summary: India's central bank has proposed linking BRICS nations' digital currencies to facilitate cross-border trade and tourism payments, potentially reducing reliance on the U.S. dollar. This initiative, to be discussed at the 2026 BRICS summit, builds on previous calls for payment system interoperability among member states.

articles.title: National Highway builders ask Finmin to clarify arbitration order
articles.summary: The National Highway Builders Federation has urged the finance ministry to clarify its order ending arbitration for highway projects. The federation warns this change discourages investment and increases project costs. It suggests the new dispute resolution framework could make projects unbankable. This impacts ongoing projects and future infrastructure development. The federation is also flagging concerns with bankers and financial lenders.

articles.title: CII's Biz Confidence Index climbs to five-quarter high in Q3 FY26
articles.summary: Business confidence in India is soaring, reaching a five-quarter high. Firms are optimistic about demand, profitability, and investment. GST rate cuts and festive spending are boosting sales. The industry expects the Reserve Bank of India to cut repo rates. CII suggests continued reforms and infrastructure investment for sustained growth.

articles.title: India’s manufacturing index hits all-time high in Q3 FY26: FICCI survey
articles.summary: India’s manufacturing index touched an all-time high in Q3 FY26, with 91% of firms reporting stable or higher production, supported by improved demand sentiment following recent GST rate cuts, a FICCI survey showed.

articles.title: US Senators pitch for favourable pulse crop provision in potential India-US trade pact
articles.summary: In a letter dated January 16, 2026, US Senators Kevin Cramer and Steve Daines have encouraged the US President "to push for favourable pulse crop provisions in any agreement the United States" signs with India as trade negotiations progress.

articles.title: Commerce Ministry: India-US trade talks progressing, no fixed deadline yet

articles.title: ITC Denied on Electrical Works for Factory Expansion as Immovable Property: AAAR TN
articles.summary: The appellate authority ruled that electrical installation works for a new factory form part of immovable property. articles.title: Interactive Flat Panel Displays Taxed at 28% as ‘Monitors’ Under HSN 85285900: AAAR Tamilnadu

articles.summary: The group is also building an OSAT facility. This is in view of a larger plan to create a hub for chiplet integration and advanced system-in-package technologies.

articles.summary: The latest advisory comes as anti-India sentiment continues to soar in Bangladesh. The first polls of the post-Sheikh Hasina era are scheduled for 12 February.

articles.summary: Donald Trump posts private message from French President Macron after France declined to join proposed Board of Peace, reviving disputes over Gaza, tariffs and Greenland.

articles.summary: UAE President arrived for 3-hour visit that saw Abu Dhabi   New Delhi agree to develop a framework for strategic defence partnership, while also concluding long-term purchase agreements for LNG.

articles.summary: Talks between EAM Jaishankar and Polish counterpart continued about an hour past scheduled time, indicating depth of the conversation. Polish Deputy PM also met NSA Ajit Doval.

articles.summary: Jaishankar makes it clear in meeting with Poland's Radosław Sikorski that India’s issue was not just with US tariffs, but also actions taken by EU to curb purchases of Russian oil.

articles.summary: Other countries invited include Pakistan, Argentina, Jordan and Canada. Draft charter indicates Board may go beyond Gaza, appoints Donald Trump as chairman until he resigns.

articles.summary: For Japan, diversification of supply chains is important given its rising tensions with Beijing. For India and Japan, focus on ensuring US engagement in the region, says Japanese spokesperson.

articles.summary: The European Union is India’s single-largest trading partner when exports and imports with all 27 member-states are calculated. The deal has been almost two decades in the making.

articles.summary: This comes a day after MEA advised Indian nationals to leave Iran by any available means of transport as the situation in the West Asian country continued to spiral.

articles.summary: China’s exports to India have grown by 13.46 per cent between the first nine months of the 2024-2025 financial year and the 2025-26 financial year, according to the latest trade data.

articles.summary: George Yeo was speaking at the 43rd CD Deshmukh Memorial Lecture in Delhi where he spoke about the importance of India-China ties in the Trump era.

articles.title: Project Rise: How Dawoodi Bohras are tackling malnutrition crisis in Maharashtra’s tribal belt
articles.summary: In collaboration with govt   non-profit, project aims to build trust, improve nutrition. It has shown measurable success in Nandurbar district, now under implementation in Chandrapur.

articles.summary: Division bench of Delhi HC overturned 2019 order by single-judge bench, restoring ban on manufacture, sale, and distribution of triple-drug combinations for type 2 diabetes.

articles.title: Screen Reader iconScreen Reader
FTC says it will appeal Meta antitrust decision
articles.summary: The FTC said it continues to allege that, for more than a decade, Meta Platforms Inc. has "illegally maintained a monopoly" in social networking through anticompetitive conduct "by buying the significant competitive threats it identified in Instagram and WhatsApp."

articles.title: Regulatory clarity key for crypto adoption: Binance co-CEO Richard Teng
articles.summary: Binance co-CEO Richard Teng says clearer crypto regulations are needed for wider adoption in India, even as the US leads the sector. He views crypto as complementary to UPI and sees AI and blockchain as mutually reinforcing technologies. Teng also explained why enthusiasm around central bank digital currencies is dying globally.

articles.title: Tier-II GCC dream awaits govt bridge to cross execution gap
articles.summary: Despite budget promise, government has not formalised national framework; global firms stay cautious over talent depth and fragmented rules.

articles.title: AI, Big Tech and Trump shine most brightly at the Davos spectacle
articles.summary: Davos showcased a tech-driven World Economic Forum, where AI parties, corporate optimism and Donald Trump anticipation eclipsed climate and equity talks. Amid crowds, tech giants dominated, executives embraced profit-first politics, and Europe braced to confront Donald Trump over tariffs and Greenland.

articles.title: Anthropic CEO warns against Nvidia chip sales to China
articles.summary: The CEO of leading Artificial Intelligence company Anthropic on Tuesday warned against the Trump administration's recent move to greenlight sales of a powerful Nvidia chip to China, comparing it to selling nuclear weapon technology to North Korea.

articles.title: Netflix intensifies bid for Warner Bros making its $72 billion offer all cash
articles.summary: Netflix is now offering to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming business in all cash - in an effort to win over the Hollywood giant's shareholders for its $72 billion merger and potentially thwart a hostile bid from Skydance-owned Paramount.

articles.title: Digital payments firm PhonePe gets Sebi approval for $1.5-billion IPO
articles.summary: PhonePe has received Sebi approval for its $1.5 billion IPO, which could value the Walmart-backed fintech at around $15 billion. The company, a market leader in UPI payments, has expanded into credit, insurance, and stockbroking. Last year, it narrowed losses and grew revenue 40%, highlighting strong financial momentum.

articles.title: No option 'off the table' as UK mulls social media ban for children
articles.summary: Britain is considering tougher limits on children’s social media use, with no ideas ruled out, including possible bans. Prime Minister Keir Starmer warned that constant scrolling harms young people’s wellbeing and growth. Starmer said parents would be offered evidence-based advice on how long children aged five to 16 should spend on phones, tablets and computers, with separate guidance for under-fives to be published in April.

articles.title: Taiwan's Inventec says decision on Nvidia's H200 chip 'appears to be stuck' on China's side
articles.summary: The U.S. formally approved the chip for export to China last week ‌with some ‌conditions. Reuters reported last week that Chinese customs authorities told customs agents that the ‌H200 chip was not permitted to enter China though it was not clear whether this constituted a formal ban or a temporary measure.

articles.title: PhonePe gets Sebi nod for IPO; Microsoft, Walmart to pare stake in OFS
articles.summary: Walmart-backed PhonePe has secured Sebi approval for its IPO, clearing a major hurdle for one of India’s biggest fintech listings. The $14.5-billion startup plans a $1.5-billion OFS, with Walmart, Tiger Global, and Microsoft set to sell shares. Strong payments dominance and rising revenues underpin investor confidence.

articles.title: India among most important markets for us, will continue to invest there: Cisco
articles.summary: Speaking to PTI here during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, the company's President and Chief Product Officer said India accounts for the largest concentration of its people outside the US.

articles.title: AI most profound platform shift in human history; every job, workflow will be reconfigured: Cisco
articles.summary: Speaking to PTI here during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, the technology giant's President and Chief Product Officer, Jeetu Patel, said every job will get reconfigured, and every workflow is going to change due to AI.

articles.title: Space next big place for data centres: Cisco
articles.summary: Patel, President and Chief Product Officer at Cisco, said while green data centres are going to be very prominent soon, the next few years would witness those centres being built in the space to tackle infrastructure, mainly power, constraints.

articles.title: Lodha Developers to invest $11 billion in 2.5 GW data centre park in Maharashtra
articles.summary: ​India's Lodha ⁠Developers said on Tuesday ‌that it ‌would ‌invest an additional Rs 1 lakh crore ($11 billion) ​to ​build a ‌2.5 ‍gigawatt data ‍centre park in the ‌state of Maharashtra, expanding on an ‍earlier commitment of Rs 30,000 ‍crore.

articles.title: Japan, US narrow first $550 billion investment picks, including SoftBank-linked plan, sources say
articles.summary: The two governments have intensified discussions to select the initial projects ‌under the ‌investment scheme, agreed as part of Tokyo's deal with Washington to lower tariffs on Japanese exports ‌to the United States, the sources said on Monday.

articles.title: Malaysia's Khazanah to steer more capital to power grids, chip firms, chief says in Davos
articles.summary: Surging AI computing needs were reshaping what is "investable" in the AI boom, with energy supply and grid resilience being central to ‌competitiveness, Khazanah ‌Managing Director Amirul Feisal Wan Zahir said in an interview at the World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos.

articles.title: Taylor Swift label UMG inks licensing deal with China's NetEase Cloud Music
articles.summary: The ‌multi-year license ‌agreement allows UMG-signed artists like Taylor ‌Swift to stream on NetEase's platform. The deal includes provisions and terms covering artificial intelligence both companies ​said reflect a "shared ​commitment to responsible AI practices ‌that ‍support and protect the ‍music and artists that UMG represents," ‌in a statement announcing the deal.

articles.title: Ecommerce platforms may post 20-22% growth in Republic Day sales
articles.summary: Ecommerce marketplaces such as Amazon India and Flipkart are set to post 20–22% growth during their ongoing Republic Day sales compared with last year, extending the online shopping momentum seen during the 2025 festive season, according to industry experts.

articles.title: Indians face more US visa refusals on social media scrutiny
articles.summary: Indians are facing increasing temporary US visa refusals under section 221(g), with stricter background checks, social media vetting, and scrutiny of old arrest records causing delays. Even applicants with valid documents are affected, and appointments are being pushed to later in the year. The process now requires additional documents, slowing visa approvals further.

articles.title: India must speed up AI upskilling: Coursera cofounder Andrew Ng
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is redrawing the skills map for India’s $280 billion IT services industry, and unless professionals upskill at speed, job disruption could be severe, said AI pioneer Andrew Ng, founder of DeepLearning.AI and cofounder of Coursera. He also cautioned against the swelling hype over AGI, arguing that large language models are not a path to human-level intelligence and that claims of AGI being imminent are misleading.

articles.title: Meta 'turning a blind eye' to illegal gambling ads, UK Gambling Commission says
articles.summary: Britain's Gambling Commission said on Monday that ‍Meta Platforms, the ​owner of Facebook and Instagram, was turning a ⁠blind eye to illegal online casinos advertising on its sites, indicating it was happy to continue taking money from criminals.

articles.title: OpenAI CFO says annualised revenue crosses $20 billion in 2025
articles.summary: OpenAI chief financial officer Sarah Friar ‍said in a blog ​post on Sunday the company's annualized ⁠revenue has surpassed $20 billion in 2025, up from $6 billion in 2024 with growth closely tracking an expansion in computing ‌capacity.

articles.title: WEF 2026: MP govt holds talks with Tech Mahindra president on expanding IT, BPO in tier-II cities
articles.summary: The Government of Madhya Pradesh on Monday interacted with Harshul Asnani, president of Tech Mahindra, to look at entering the state of Madhya Pradesh with a focus on expanding in tier-II cities to deepen access to talent.

articles.title: Kerala: CM Vijayan opens his State’s work-near-home facility at Kollam
articles.summary: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday launched ‘Commune’, the pilot centre of his government’s ambitious work-near-home (WNH) project, which he called an important step towards building Kerala as a thriving skill hub.

articles.title: World Economic Forum 2026: Global tech titans gather at Davos
articles.summary: Tech titans scheduled to be on hand include Jensen Huang of Nvidia. Microsoft's Satya Nadella, Demis Hassabis of Google DeepMind, and Arthur Mensch of France's Mistral AI.

articles.title: UK, France mull social media bans for youth as debate rages
articles.summary: Countries including France and Britain are considering following Australia's lead by banning children and some teenagers from using social media, but experts are still locked in a debate over the effectiveness of the move. France is currently debating bills for a similar ban for under-15s, including one championed by President Emmanuel Macron.

articles.title: Ola Electric CFO Harish Abichandani resigns; Deepak Rastogi appointed successor
articles.summary: Electric ⁠two-wheeler maker Ola Electric on Monday named Deepak Rastogi as its new finance ‌chief, ‌effective January 20. Rastogi, who most ‌recently was the group finance chief of property developer Puravankara, will succeed Harish Abichandani, Ola said.

articles.title: Shadowfax secures Rs 856 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
articles.summary: Logistics firm Shadowfax Technologies has secured approximately Rs 850 crore from anchor investors ahead of its IPO, which opens on January 20. The company has reduced its IPO size to Rs 1,907 crore, with a focus on diversifying its client base towards D2C brands and smaller retailers. Shadowfax reported a 68% rise in operating revenues to Rs 1,805.

articles.title: Trump to meet global CEOs in Davos, with US policy in focus
articles.summary: Business leaders, including CEOs in ‌financial services, crypto and ‌consulting, were invited to a reception after Trump's address to the World Economic Forum's annual meeting. The agenda was unclear.

articles.title: Space sector eyes further investment growth in 2026 after record year
articles.summary: Investors expect the funding momentum to be ‌driven by spending on sovereign satellite and missile-defence systems, integration of AI into space hardware and analytics, and the prospect of a SpaceX IPO, Seraphim Space said. Investments in the ‌sector hit record levels in 2025, with private investment growing 48% to $12.4 billion, including $3.8 billion in the final quarter, according to data from Seraphim Space.

articles.title: ASM International's bookings beat market view as China orders rebound
articles.summary: Europe's second largest chipmaking equipment manufacturer also hiked ‌its guidance for the first quarter of 2026. It now sees a "healthy" revenue increase on a constant currency basis compared to last quarter, having previously forecast a slow ​start to the year.

articles.title: As ChatGPT introduces ads, Google says it has no such plans for Gemini
articles.summary: Senior Google executive Taylor noted that Gemini and search are "complementary tools with different roles." Search, he said, helps users discover new information that "can include commercial interests like new products or services", while "Gemini is your AI assistant" focussed on helping users "create, analyse, and complete" tasks.

articles.title: South Korea's Lee, Italy's Meloni agree to strengthen cooperation in AI, chips
articles.summary: South ⁠Korean President Lee ‌Jae Myung ‌and ‌Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni ​agreed ​on Monday to ‌expand ‍cooperation ‍in sectors such ‌as artificial intelligence, aerospace, chips ‍and critical ‍minerals, according to ⁠the ⁠Blue House.

articles.title: Micron says ‘unprecedented’ memory shortage to last beyond 2026
articles.summary: High-bandwidth memory required to make artificial intelligence accelerators is “consuming so much of the available capacity across the industry that it’s leaving a tremendous shortage for the conventional side of the industry, for phones or PCs,” Bhatia said. He added that PC and smartphone makers have joined the queue to try to lock up memory chips after 2026.

articles.title: South Korea to negotiate with the US for favourable chip tariff terms, official says
articles.summary: The country ‌last year released a joint fact sheet on its trade deal with the U.S. that ​included terms ensuring ​South Korea will not ‌receive unfavourable ‍treatment from U.S. ‍tariffs on imported chips compared to ‌key competitors, the official said, when asked about the Trump administration's proclamation imposing tariffs on artificial intelligence chips.

articles.title: Micron's $1.8 billion acquisition boosts Powerchip shares
articles.summary: Micron Technology on Saturday ‌said it had signed a letter of intent to ‍acquire Powerchip's P5 ‍fabrication site ⁠in ⁠Tongluo, Miaoli County, Taiwan, for $1.8 billion in cash.

articles.title: Groww steps up wealth play via MF and portfolio management solutions
articles.summary: Groww is expanding deeper into wealth management by developing platforms for high-net-worth clients and mutual fund distributors. This follows its acquisition of Fisdom, which has been integrated into Groww’s operations. The Bengaluru-based firm aims to scale digital tools to help distributors service clients and compete with startups like AssetPlus and ZFunds.

articles.title: Nano GCC attrition shaped by clearly defined roadmaps
articles.summary: India’s nano GCCs are diverging, with long-term centres showing 80-88% employee retention, while short-term or contract-led setups face high churn. Smaller teams of 20-150 employees are highly sensitive to attrition, affecting product delivery and IP development. Rising demand for AI and specialised tech skills is driving targeted hiring and higher salaries.

articles.title: Bill to allow Uber, Lyft in Israel gains committee approval
articles.summary: Israel’s ministerial committee has approved a law to allow ride-hailing services like Uber and Lyft, aiming to reduce taxi fares. The reform, still needing full parliamentary approval, sets safety rules, driver checks, and insurance while supporting existing taxi operators. Transport Minister Miri Regev said it would boost jobs, competition, and ease congestion.

articles.title: Micron to buy Taiwan chip fabrication site for $1.8 billion
articles.summary: Micron Technology plans to buy a Taiwanese fabrication site from Powerchip Semiconductor Manufacturing for $1.8 billion to boost chip production. The Tongluo site will gradually increase DRAM production, with major volumes expected by 2027, alongside a partnership on assembly processing. The move supports Micron’s global expansion, including investment in new US plants.

articles.title: Social media addiction's surprising challenger? Anti-doomscrolling influencers
articles.summary: Social media users often lose track of time scrolling. Content creators like Olivia Unplugged and Cat Goetze are appearing on platforms to gently remind people about their screen time. They explain the psychology behind social media's addictive nature. Experts agree people spend too much time on apps.

articles.title: In a cooling job market, AI pros still hold the cards
articles.summary: AI professionals are getting not just multiple offers but also counter-offers from existing employers and big incentives. New job offers and counteroffers currently come with 25-70% pay hikes for AI professionals, executives at search firms and recruitment services firms said. This trend is only going to get stronger in 2026, they told ET.

articles.title: Netweb Technologies Q3 profit more than doubles to Rs 73 crore
articles.summary: In an impressive display of growth, Netweb Technologies reported record-breaking quarterly profit and revenue from October to December. The company’s profit after tax soared to Rs 73.31 crore, marking a notable increase year-on-year. Revenue followed suit with a remarkable climb to Rs 811.56 crore.

articles.title: Tax structure for MNCs with India biz may be reworked
articles.summary: India is considering revamping its permanent establishment tax framework, including formula-based profit attribution, to protect taxing rights, offer clarity to MNCs and digital firms, and reduce long-running tax disputes.

articles.title: Road map in works for $100 billion textile and apparel exports by 2030
articles.summary: India plans to significantly boost textile exports to $100 billion by 2030. The strategy involves increasing shipments to Free Trade Agreement partners and focusing on premium products like handlooms and silk. New districts will be developed to join the export ecosystem. This initiative aims to expand India's global market share in textiles.

articles.title: India FTA to create market of 2 billion people: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen
articles.summary: The European Union is on the brink of a landmark trade agreement with India, potentially linking a consumer base of two billion individuals. In a bid to strengthen these negotiations, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen is scheduled to visit India shortly. This strategic move reflects the EU's goal of broadening its global trade horizons and fostering international collaboration.

articles.title: RMZ signs MoU with Andhra Pradesh to invest up to $10 billion in infrastructure
articles.summary: RMZ commits $10 billion to Andhra Pradesh for mixed-use, digital, industrial, and logistics infrastructure over five to six years. Plans include a 10 million sq ft IT park and a 1 GW data centre in Visakhapatnam, plus a 1,000-acre industrial park in Rayalaseema, aiming to boost employment and technology-led growth.

articles.title: “Mother of all trade deals” with India coming soon: EU’s Ursula von der Leyen at WEF
Reduce customs duty slabs in Budget 2026: GTRI
articles.summary: India's customs duty structure needs simplification. The Global Trade Research Initiative suggests reducing the actual number of duty slabs, not just basic customs duty rates. This reform aims to boost ease of doing business. Current complexities hinder manufacturing and exports. Simplifying tariffs and processes is crucial for economic growth and competitiveness.

articles.title: India’s core sectors' growth accelerates to 4-month high of 3.7% in December
articles.summary: India's eight core infrastructure sectors grew by 3.7% in December 2025, a slowdown from the previous year but an acceleration from November's 2.1% expansion. This growth, driven by coal, fertilisers, steel, cement, and electricity, signals a positive trend for industrial momentum as these sectors hold significant weight in the Index of Industrial Production.

articles.title: India-Europe ‘mother of all deals’ within reach as EU chief Ursula von der Leyen hints at breakthrough
articles.summary: In a move that could redefine trade relationships, India and the European Union are finalising a groundbreaking free trade agreement. EU dignitaries Ursula von der Leyen and Charles Michel are set to be the esteemed Chief Guests at India's Republic Day celebration.

articles.title: Govt to extend quality certification fee concessions for small firms by 3 years
articles.summary: Quality certification fee concessions for small and medium enterprises will be extended by three years. This move supports India's manufacturing sector. The Bureau of Indian Standards is facilitating this extension. Micro units will receive an 80 percent fee reduction. Small enterprises get a 50 percent reduction. Medium-sized firms will benefit from a 20 percent concession.

articles.title: Ignore gold's message at your peril
articles.summary: Gold emerged as a top performer in 2025, a year marked by significant global financial market turmoil. This surge in gold's value is linked to political instability and economic uncertainty. Central banks worldwide increased their gold purchases, seeking protection. The article highlights gold's historical role as a hedge against inflation and currency depreciation during turbulent times.

articles.title: India's sugar output jumps 22% to 15.9 million tonnes by mid January: ISMA
articles.summary: India's sugar production has seen a significant jump of 22 percent by mid-January in the 2025-26 season. Higher cane supplies and improved yields are supporting this growth. Mills are operating at a higher capacity. However, falling sugar prices are impacting mill finances and farmer payments.

articles.title: FICCI's Manufacturing Index reaches all-time high in Q3 FY26
articles.summary: India's manufacturing sector shows sustained growth and optimism, with 91% reporting higher or same production levels in Q3 FY 2025-26. Domestic demand is also strong, with 86% anticipating increased orders. Despite capacity utilization near 75%, global and operational challenges are noted, though export expectations remain positive.

articles.title: India's billion-dollar trade deal may be the real show this Republic Day
articles.summary: India and the European Union are set to announce the conclusion of negotiations for a long-pending free trade agreement at a summit in New Delhi on January 27, coinciding with India’s 77th Republic Day celebrations. The deal, described by Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal as the “mother of all trade deals,” caps nearly two decades of stop-start talks and is expected to be signed in the coming months after legal clearances.

articles.title: Budget 2026 and why stability, not scale, matters in today’s fractured global order
articles.summary: India's democratic institutions offer a rare competitive edge in a volatile global economy. As geopolitical risks reshape trade, regulatory certainty and predictable processes are paramount for attracting investment. Reforms in customs, export controls, and stakeholder consultation are crucial for building a trustworthy, rules-based economic ecosystem, shielding currency risks from becoming investment hesitations.

articles.title: Trump effect: Cotton fabrics exports drop 30%
articles.summary: Indian cotton textile exports saw a sharp fall after the US introduced tariffs in August 2025. Shipments dropped by nearly 30 percent following the levy. This decline impacted all categories, including fabrics, made-ups, and ready-made garments. Companies are exploring strategies like discounts to mitigate the impact. The situation is expected to remain volatile for some time.

articles.title: US-EU bitter trade row may boost India exports, sweeten Europe FTA
articles.summary: A potential US-EU trade dispute could boost Indian exports as the EU seeks stronger ties with nations like India. With the US imposing tariffs on several European goods, the EU may expedite its free trade agreement talks with India. This could lead to a more favorable deal and faster ratification, presenting India as a stable trade partner amidst global uncertainties.

articles.title: India, EU set to conclude FTA talks on January 27; deal after legal clearances
articles.summary: India and the European Union will announce the conclusion of free trade agreement negotiations at a summit on January 27. A security and defence partnership agreement will also be signed. EU leadership will attend India's Republic Day celebrations as chief guests. Negotiations for the trade pact resumed in 2022 and are in the final stages.

articles.title: India ranks 16 among 154 countries on Responsible Nations Index
articles.summary: India secured 16th place out of 154 countries in the new Responsible Nations Index, a framework assessing national conduct towards citizens, the environment, and the world. The index, launched by the World Intellectual Foundation, highlights that economic strength doesn't guarantee responsible behavior, with developing nations often outperforming wealthier ones in key areas.

articles.title: China urges WTO to set up panel in case against India's incentive schemes for auto, battery, EV
articles.summary: China has requested the WTO's dispute settlement body to establish a panel to examine its case against India's incentive schemes for auto, battery, and electric vehicles. Bilateral consultations failed to resolve the dispute, with China alleging the schemes violate global trade rules by discriminating against its goods.

articles.title: RBI Guv Malhotra calls for high standards of governance in urban co-op banks
articles.summary: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra met with top officials of select Urban Cooperative Banks, stressing the importance of strong governance and asset quality oversight. He acknowledged UCBs' role in credit delivery and financial inclusion, expressing confidence that recent policy initiatives will foster sector growth and health.

articles.title: India-EU Summit: Trade, defence and mobility deals on table
articles.summary: European Council President Antonio Costa and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will be the chief guests at the Republic Day celebrations on January 26, and the India-EU summit will be held the next day.

articles.title: India-UAE aim to double trade to $200 billion by 2032; ink deals on LNG, defence, and space
articles.summary: India and the UAE have set an ambitious target to double bilateral trade to $200 billion by 2032, signing key agreements in energy, defense, and space. A 10-year LNG supply deal between HPCL and ADNOC was confirmed, bolstering India's energy security. The nations also advanced defense and space cooperation, signaling a decade of closer economic and strategic integration.

articles.title: Provide incentive in Budget for R&D, create specialised fin institution for long-term fund: MPC member Nagesh Kumar
articles.summary: RBI MPC member Nagesh Kumar urged the government to offer policy incentives for R D and establish an institutional fund for long-term manufacturing capital in the upcoming Budget. He also suggested restoring the 200% weighted tax deduction for R D expenditure and creating a specialized development financing institution for manufacturing to boost growth and competitiveness.

articles.title: India's December oilmeal exports fall 40% on weak soyabean meal shipments
articles.summary: In December, India's oilmeal exports plummeted by 40 percent, largely attributed to a drastic decline in soyabean meal shipments. Other oilmeals, such as rapeseed and castorseed meals, also saw diminished export levels. Conversely, the exports of rice bran extraction experienced a remarkable upswing. Over the April-December timeframe, total oilmeal exports faced a 6 percent drop.

articles.title: Goodbye VCRs, hello OTT: India’s inflation basket prepares for a reset
articles.summary: India's inflation gauge is undergoing a significant overhaul, phasing out outdated items like VCRs and introducing modern essentials such as smartphones and streaming services. While free food from the public distribution system will be excluded to align with global norms and prevent inflation distortion, this decision sparks debate among economists about a complete inflation picture.

articles.title: IMF raises India's FY26 growth forecast to 7.3%
articles.summary: India's economic growth is projected to be robust. The International Monetary Fund has increased its forecast for India's FY26 growth to 7.3 percent. This makes India the fastest-growing economy among major nations. The World Bank also revised its outlook upwards. Global growth is expected to be steady. Inflation in India is anticipated to return to target levels.

articles.title: RBI likely to keep interest rates steady as inflation edges up, Crisil says
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is anticipated to hold its key policy rates steady. This decision comes as inflation shows a moderate increase. Despite this, the economic outlook remains positive with strong growth projections. Experts foresee a stable monetary policy environment for the upcoming period. This approach balances economic expansion with price stability.

articles.title: Greenland shock: Europe's pain proves India read Donald Trump right
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump's trade threats have created a crisis for European Union trade deals. EU lawmakers are now preparing to retaliate against the US. This situation highlights the wisdom of India's careful trade negotiations. India avoided rushing into agreements, prioritising its national interests. This approach has preserved India's strategic options and negotiating strength.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India Inc seeks GST-style simplification in customs duty structure
articles.summary: As Budget 2026 discussions ramp up, Indian businesses are gearing up for transformative shifts in customs duties. They are advocating for a seamless framework akin to GST, aiming to enhance trade efficiency and expedite dispute resolution. Their requests include a consolidated clearance window, expedited timelines for Authorized Economic Operator (AEO) certification, and a more efficient customs investigation protocol.

articles.title: IMF raises India’s 2025 growth target to 7.3% while the world shakes off tariff disruptions
articles.summary: IMF India growth outlook has been revised upward for 2025 by 0.7 pp to 7.3 percent. This is due to better corporate earnings and strong economic momentum. IMF said global economy is also showing resilience. AI investment is a key driver. Global growth is projected to hold steady. Inflation is expected to decline. However, the risks include AI sector valuations and geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: Govt permits exports of 5 lakh tonnes of wheat flour
articles.summary: The government has allowed limited exports of wheat flour and related products, permitting shipments of up to 5 lakh tonnes, marking a partial easing of the ban imposed in 2022. The Directorate General of Foreign Trade said exports will remain prohibited beyond this quota and will require prior authorisation.

articles.title: India set to move into upper-middle-income group by 2030 & join China: SBI
articles.summary: India is likely to enter the upper-middle-income group by the end of this decade, joining China and Indonesia, according to a report by the State Bank of India (SBI). SBI said India is expected to reach a per capita income of $4,000 by 2030, meeting the current threshold for the category.

articles.title: A trade deal India pursued for 18 years is now within reach but risks remain
articles.summary: India is on the cusp of sealing a transformative free trade agreement with the European Union, marking the largest of its kind for the country. This landmark deal encompasses a wide range of goods and services, paving the way for enhanced economic collaboration. Nevertheless, ongoing discussions are needed regarding climate taxes and the mobility of services.

articles.title: View: Why India has a private investment problem
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow at 7.4%, yet Prime Minister Modi faces a critical decision between continued infrastructure spending and fiscal restraint. Despite strong headline growth, low private investment and a ballooning debt-to-GDP ratio of 81% signal what may be an unsustainable model.

articles.title: Commerce Ministry formulates specific guidelines for missions abroad to boost exports
articles.summary: New guidelines are in place for Indian missions abroad. The government aims to boost exports by diversifying markets. These steps are crucial amid global economic uncertainties. Commercial representatives will manage trade barriers and conduct market research. The goal is to leverage free trade agreements and increase their utilization. India targets USD 2 trillion in exports by 2030.

articles.title: AI benefits must be distributed evenly to avoid it becoming a bubble: Nadella
articles.summary: Speaking at a session at Davos during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, Nadella said it will be a "tell-tale" sign of a bubble if all the AI talk focused only on the supply side or the technology companies.

articles.title: Brazil gives Musk's xAI 30 days to tackle fake sexualised content from Grok
articles.summary: The Brazilian ‌consumer protection agency Senacon, data protection authority ANPD and the Office of Federal Prosecutors said they can take further administrative or judicial measures if X does not ​comply.

articles.title: Emergent bags major funding; Sebi greenlights PhonePe IPO
articles.summary: Happy Wednesday! AI startup Emergent has raised fresh funding, tripling its valuation to around $300 million. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: Persistent Systems Q3 profit jumps 17.8% YoY, beats estimates despite labour code hit
articles.summary: Mid-tier IT services company Persistent Systems has reported a 17.8% year-on-year increase in December-quarter net profit, despite taking a one-time charge due to labour code changes, surpassing analyst estimates

articles.title: An AI startup says it wants to empower workers, not replace them
articles.summary: Former Anthropic researcher Andi Peng left to cofound Humans , rejecting AI that replaces workers. Backed by Nvidia and Jeff Bezos, the funded startup pursues human-centric systems that collaborate with users, signaling investor confidence in alternative AI visions despite bubble fears.

articles.title: OpenAI concludes AI Jam sessions to drive AI adoption in social sector
articles.summary: OpenAI on Tuesday said it has concluded its India edition of the 'Nonprofit AI Jam', a multi-city series bringing together leaders and professionals for a hands-on working session on using artificial intelligence (AI) to drive effective, scalable outcomes.

articles.title: Portuguese tech companies meet Karnataka startups to explore AI, robotics partnerships
articles.summary: The interaction took place at the Global Innovation Alliance (GIA) - Portugal Edition, on Tuesday.

articles.title: AI startup Humans& raises $480 million at $4.5 billion valuation in seed round
articles.summary: AI startup Humans has secured a massive $480 million in seed funding. This significant investment values the company at $4.48 billion. The funding round was led by SV Angel and saw participation from Nvidia, Jeff Bezos, and Alphabet's GV. Humans aims to develop advanced AI systems that can plan, learn, and collaborate over extended periods.

articles.title: WEF 2026: Philips keen to partner with Telangana on AI, to explore setting up knowledge hub
articles.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy-led 'Telangana Rising' delegation on Tuesday met the global leadership of renowned health tech company Royal Philips at the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum 2026 in Davos, Switzerland.

articles.title: AM Group to build $25 billion GW scale AI compute hub in Uttar Pradesh
articles.summary: The project, announced at the World Economic Forum 2026 in Davos, involves a total investment of approximately $25 billion. This hub is designed to handle global AI workloads and will be one of the largest investments in India's digital infrastructure to date.

articles.title: Bristol Myers partners with Microsoft for AI-driven lung cancer detection
articles.summary: Bristol Myers Squibb is joining forces with Microsoft. They will use artificial intelligence to find lung cancer earlier. This technology analyses X-ray and CT scans. The goal is to help doctors spot difficult nodules. It also aims to identify patients at earlier disease stages.

articles.title: WEF 2026: Madhya Pradesh delegation discusses AI for agriculture, green data centres with Google
articles.summary: In a significant move to bolster its digital infrastructure and innovation ecosystem, the Government of Madhya Pradesh met Sanjay Gupta, President of Asia Pacific at Google, at the World Economic Forum (WEF) 2026 on Tuesday.

articles.title: Legal AI startup Ivo raises $55 million in latest funding round
articles.summary: IVO-Legal AI startup Ivo raises $55 million in latest funding round

articles.title: BCCI bags Rs 270 crore AI sponsorship deal for IPL
articles.summary: The BCCI has inked a significant Rs 270 crore sponsorship deal with Google's AI platform Gemini. This partnership will span three years, beginning with the 2026 Indian Premier League. The agreement highlights the growing interest of artificial intelligence companies in Indian cricket. Gemini's rival, ChatGPT, is also a sponsor of the ongoing Women's Premier League.

articles.title: LTIMindtree to roll out wage hikes in Q4; 50% workforce to be covered in first phase
articles.summary: LTIMindtree will begin annual pay rises from Q4 FY26, covering half its staff initially and spreading increases over two quarters to protect margins. Chandra noted that the financial impact of the wage hike is expected to be approximately 1% in each of the two quarters. However, the company aims to offset this through operational efficiencies and its "New Horizon" enterprise-wide programme.

articles.title: Ursula von der Leyen speaks at World Economic Forum | Davos 2026 LIVE
AI startup Emergent raises $70 million from Khosla Ventures, SoftBank; valuation triples to $300 million
articles.summary: Emergent has raised $70 million in new funding, lifting its valuation to about $300 million just months after launch. The startup helps users build apps cheaply using AI and has grown revenues rapidly worldwide. The latest financing comes three months after Emergent raised $23 million led by Lightspeed.

articles.title: Capgemini plans to cut up to 2,400 jobs in France
articles.summary: Capgemini plans to cut up to 2,400 jobs in France, that is, around 6% of its local workforce, as weak demand hits its home market. The slowdown has affected sectors such as automotive, reducing client spending on IT services. Capgemini intends to implement the reductions through voluntary departures and offer ‍internal retraining programs for workers in divisions ‍affected by ⁠shifting ⁠client demand.

articles.title: ET@Davos: Andrew Ng on Job Displacement, AGI Myth and India’s Crossroads
Everstone-owned Wingify to buy AB Tasty, create $500 million SaaS entity
articles.summary: Everstone-owned Wingify is acquiring Paris-based AB Tasty in a deal valuing the combined company at around $500 million. The merged firm, led by Wingify CEO Sparsh Gupta, will have over 800 employees across 11 global offices and focus on AI-driven digital experience optimisation. It will compete with Adobe, Optimizely, and Bloomreach.

articles.title: VC firm Avaana Capital appoints Vikas Verma as partner, promotes Shruti Srivastava
articles.summary: Founded in 2018, Avaana Capital has backed startups such as Aerem, Amperehour, Eeki Foods, Kazam, Turno and GreenGrahi, and has previously invested in companies such as Agnikul, Delhivery, Nykaa and Urban Company. The fund’s focus areas include deeptech entrepreneurs building in the fields of energy, mobility and supply chains, advanced manufacturing, AI and robotics.

articles.title: Tech cos wooing graduates with AI, cloud, other specialised skills at higher pay packages: Report
articles.summary: According to a report in The Times of India, tech companies are offering pay cheques from Rs 16 lakh to Rs 55 lakh to freshers for niche roles, about four times higher than the Rs 4-lakh package usually seen for fresher hiring. Entry-level hiring has slowed overall, but companies are increasingly giving priority to recruiting fewer specialised roles rather than volume hiring.

articles.title: View: India is cornered by China’s lock on tech
articles.summary: India-China trade: India's industrial growth faces a new challenge as China restricts technology transfers. This impacts key sectors like electric vehicles and energy storage, affecting major Indian conglomerates. Despite recent diplomatic overtures, Beijing's stance highlights a significant technology gap. India's 'Make in India' initiative struggles against this dominance.

articles.title: Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: The unnatural beauty of Dhurandhar: Why Aditya Dhar's polarising film works as pure cinema
articles.summary: A visually arresting, fiercely polarising action thriller, Dhurandhar transcends propaganda debates through raw performances, brutal choreography, and an uncanny portrayal of familiar worlds rendered disturbingly strange.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: India's GIFT City regulator proposes rules to ring-fence algo trading
articles.summary: International Financial Services Centres Authority proposed that a market participant undertaking algorithmic trading may only be able to do so with the prior permission of an exchange.

articles.title: US V-P JD Vance, wife Usha Vance say they are expecting their fourth child late July
articles.summary: Usha is a litigator and has also clerked for Chief Justice John G Roberts of the US Supreme Court and Judge Brett Kavanaugh, then of the Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. She also has a bachelor’s degree from Yale University and a master’s from the University of Cambridge, where she was a Gates Cambridge Scholar.

articles.title: UK moves to explore warship deal with Denmark
articles.summary: Britain isn’t alone in the race. France has stepped up its lobbying efforts, having sent a Naval Group frigate to Copenhagen this week. The visit included tours for Danish lawmakers, business leaders, and the country’s business minister.

articles.title: US President Donald Trump says millions have been cut from federal payroll
articles.summary: Scott Kupor, director of the US Office of Personnel Management, said last September that there would be roughly 300,000 fewer federal workers on the payroll nationwide by the end of 2025.

articles.title: Elon Musk asks if he should buy Ryanair as brawl with CEO runs on
articles.summary: O’Leary fired back Tuesday afternoon on the airline’s X.com account, saying he would “address/undress Elon Musk Twitter tantrum” at a Dublin news conference on Wednesday. A subsequent post advertised a “Big ‘Idiot’ Seat Sale” offering 100,000 seats starting at about $20. It showed cartoon versions of the pair standing on a pedestal labelled “Big Idiots.”

articles.title: Davos 2026 | GST cuts, cricket sponsorship drive tyre demand in India; Europe remains a tightrope for Apollo Tyres
articles.summary: Apollo Tyres is leaning on strong domestic demand, improved consumer spending and brand-led rural expansion to drive growth in India in 2026, even as weak volumes, rising Chinese competition and margin pressures keep its European business in a tight spot, prompting cost cuts and manufacturing realignment.

articles.title: ReNew’s Sumant Sinha explains why 2026 could be a breakout year for India’s renewable energy sector
articles.summary: India’s rapid rise as a global solar powerhouse, combined with accelerating electrification and new growth areas such as green hydrogen and data centres, could mark a turning point for the country’s clean energy ambitions. ReNew Chairman and CEO Sumant Sinha says these structural shifts may position India as a major renewable energy hub as early as 2026, even as global energy markets remain fragmented by geopolitics.

articles.title: Space race on with endeavour to return to Moon sustainably: Sunita Williams
articles.summary: Wearing a trademark deep blue space overalls and sporting a pair of space-themed canvas shoes, Williams, 60, strode into an auditorium full of Indian youths to a loud cheer, and later actively engaged with the audience with an unassuming ease, punctuating the conversation with delectable humour.

articles.title: AI, digital economy and resilient consumers are powering 2026 growth despite tariffs and geopolitical risks: Mastercard CEO
articles.summary: Mastercard CEO Michael Miebach highlights how AI, digital innovation, and digitally empowered consumers are keeping global growth robust in 2026, despite trade tensions and geopolitical uncertainties. Cross-border spending, resilient supply chains, and early holiday shopping indicate a consumer-savvy economy ready for expansion.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Saint-Gobain to accelerate capex, acquisitions in India; positions country as key export hub
articles.summary: Saint-Gobain plans to significantly scale up investments and acquisitions in India while transforming the country into a regional export hub for building materials, as strong infrastructure demand and manufacturing capabilities make India central to the group’s global growth strategy.

articles.title: IndiGo assures DGCA of operational stability, no flight cancellations after February 10
articles.summary: IndiGo Airlines met DGCA on January 19, 2026, after December 2025 disruptions. IndiGo assured no flight cancellations post February 10, 2026, citing improved crew availability and compliance.

articles.title: Delhi Airport to close third runway for upgradation and rehabilitation work from Feb 16
articles.summary: Delhi International Airport will rehabilitate Runway 11R/29L at Delhi airport from February 16, 2026, subject to regulatory approvals, with works including resurfacing, strengthening, a new rapid exit taxiway, and installation of a new instrument landing system, while maintaining the airport’s scheduled capacity of 1,514 daily movements and targeting recommissioning in early July, pending DGCA approval.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Industrial automation at a turning point as AI, sustainability and India converge: Schneider Electric CEO
articles.summary: As companies push beyond pilot projects, Schneider Electric says India’s water, steel and infrastructure sectors are emerging as key beneficiaries of AI-led industrial automation, with sustainability, electrification and cost efficiency increasingly driving investment decisions.

articles.title: ReNew's Sumant Sinha says delisting from US ‘not a bad thing’, India listing one of several options
articles.summary: ReNew CEO Sumant Sinha said the company may delist from NASDAQ due to weak US clean tech sentiment, limited investor support, and is considering other markets including India.

articles.title: India’s young, tech-savvy base makes it crypto’s biggest grassroots market, says Binance’s Teng
articles.summary: Binance co-CEO Richard Teng highlights India’s top crypto adoption, global regulatory shifts, and aims for one billion users, with US and Europe advancing AI and blockchain clarity.

articles.title: From DLF to Adani Green: 15 Nifty 500 stocks extend 10-day losing streak as sell-off deepens
articles.summary: Stocks that have declined in every session over the past 10 trading days include DLF, UNO Minda, Escorts Kubota, Procter & Gamble Hygiene & Health Care, PG Electroplast, Ola Electric Mobility, Bata India, and Whirlpool of India.

articles.title: Cipla partners ImmunoACT to launch CAR-T therapy for blood cancers in Africa
articles.summary: Cipla Limited partners with ImmunoACT to launch talicabtagene autoleucel CAR-T therapy for blood cancers in South Africa, Algeria and Morocco, expanding advanced oncology care in Africa.

articles.title: UAE President accepts US invitation to Board of Peace
articles.summary: Decision reflects support for implementation of Trump’s Gaza peace plan.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | JPMorgan’s Filippo Gori sees positive global mood, strong India flows and robust M&A pipeline
articles.summary: Geopolitics, inflation and AI expected to shape investment decisions in 2026, says

articles.title: What India Inc wants from Budget 2026: Cost relief, faster execution, policy clarity
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, leaders like Nirmala Sitharaman, Aparna Reddy, Abhimanyu Munjal and Prashant Mathur urge targeted fiscal support, faster execution and cost rationalisation for growth.

articles.title: India’s core sector growth hits four-month high in December, led by cement and steel
articles.summary: Eight core industries grew 3.7% in December, up from 2.1% in November, with cement and steel output rising sharply. Crude oil and natural gas production continued to decline.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh is open for business: ‘Just one whatsapp message away’, says Nara Lokesh at WEF
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh IT and HRD Minister Nara Lokesh said that "good news" around investments across 22 various clusters ranging from aqua, cement, renewable energy, and quantum, among other sectors can be expected in the next 90 days. Read on:

articles.title: Budget 2026 needs to be more than Aatmanirbhar
articles.summary: In a world where leverage beats values-based alliances, strategic autonomy is a necessity both for economic growth and diplomatic success. Therefore, the next budget must be anchored in foreign policy as much as local economic needs.

articles.title: What it would take for India to be a high-income country by 2047
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set a goal for India to become a developed nation by 2047. Based on recent trends and estimates, here’s a snapshot of the growth rate required to achieve that goal.

articles.title: FMCG demand stabilises after GST reset, but recovery remains uneven
articles.summary: Industry data shows FMCG growth has sustained in recent months but is now driven mainly by volumes after the GST reset and lower prices. Value growth remains softer, while competition among online and offline retail channels is increasing.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Axis Bank CEO flags deposit stress amid faster credit growth, seeks RBI liquidity push
articles.summary: Axis Bank CEO Amitabh Chaudhry warned of intense competition for deposits, urged stronger RBI liquidity support, and said credit and deposit growth cannot diverge, speaking at Davos.

articles.title: After historic profit, government moves to strengthen discoms
articles.summary: After historic profit, the Centre forms a GoM to strengthen discom finances, address state liabilities, and continue reforms that have cut losses and improved efficiency.

articles.title: Global growth to hold steady at 3.3% in 2026, says IMF; India seen growing at 6.4% in FY27
articles.summary: India’s growth outlook remains one of the strongest, with expansion projected at 6.4% in both FY27 and FY28, after an upward revision to 7.3% for FY26 on the back of a stronger-than-expected outturn. India's growth projections are 6.3% for 2026 and 6.5% for 2027 based on calendar year, the IMF said in its report.

articles.title: Explainer: Understanding market borrowing and fiscal deficit, the numbers that move markets on Budget day
articles.summary: On Budget day, markets focus on gross borrowing and fiscal deficit figures, as these impact bond yields, RBI actions, and equity valuations in banks, NBFCs, real estate and infrastructure.

articles.title: China's economy grows 5% in 2025, buoyed by strong exports despite Trump's tariffs
articles.summary: Chinese exports to the US suffered after President Donald Trump returned to office early last year and began raising tariffs. But that decline was offset by shipments to the rest of the world. Soaring imports of Chinese goods are prompting other governments to take action to protect local industries, in some cases by raising import duties.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Geoeconomic tensions top business risk for 2026, says WEF's Saadia Zahidi
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum’s Global Risks Report says geoeconomic confrontation is the top risk for 2026 and the next two years. Business leaders are worried about tariffs, investment controls, access to critical resources, and supply chains. Geopolitical and state-based conflicts are the next major concerns, according to WEF Managing Director Saadia Zahidi.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Theme, who is attending, India's presence and more — All you need to know
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum is claiming record levels of government participation, with 400 top political leaders expected to take part, alongside nearly 850 of the world's top CEOs. The top political leaders include 65 heads of state and government and six of the G7's leaders.

articles.title: DPIIT likely to ease FDI norms for existing defence license holders
articles.summary: According to CNBC-TV18 sources, the government is considering increasing the FDI limit for defence companies with existing licences from 49% to 74% under the automatic route.

articles.title: India urges start-ups to focus more on manufacturing, continue work on deep-tech
articles.summary: PM Narendra Modi urged Indian startups to pivot towards manufacturing, deep-tech and space, citing expanded procurement, funding support and policies to position India as a global technology leader.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Industries look for predictability, investment push, and targeted support
articles.summary: Industry leaders want Budget 2026 to focus on growth, reforms, fiscal stability, inclusion, and boost manufacturing, fintech, healthcare, and smaller cities.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal: India-EU FTA will be the ‘mother of all deals’; No EU member opposes
articles.summary: India and European Union may finalise a Free Trade Agreement by 27th January, with support from all 27 EU states. Talks cover CBAM, GI, critical minerals, and aim for balanced trade growth.

articles.title: ‘Nothing is grandfathered’: Supreme Court’s Tiger Global ruling puts pre-2017 Mauritius investments at risk
articles.summary: Tax experts warn verdict may embolden authorities to reopen PE, VC and FPI deals, raising fresh uncertainty for foreign investors

articles.title: Sebi proposes to allow 'netting of funds' for FPIs in cash market to trim funding cost
articles.summary: Under the current framework, an FPI needs to settle equity cash market trades on a gross basis, funding each purchase transaction independently of any sale transactions, even on the same day.

articles.title: SEBI Chairman dismisses FPI exit fears, says outflows cyclical; registration, netting reforms coming soon
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said recent foreign portfolio investor outflows are cyclical and modest relative to the scale of overseas investments in India, while outlining upcoming reforms to speed up FPI registration, ease KYC frictions and introduce netting to improve market efficiency.

articles.title: Economists warn debt and geopolitics cloud fragile global recovery: WEF report
articles.summary: Global growth expectations have stabilised, but chief economists surveyed by the World Economic Forum warn that rising debt, narrowing fiscal space and shifting trade flows are creating new fault lines across economies.

articles.title: Economists flag AI stock froth, warn of crypto slide and weaker dollar: WEF report
articles.summary: Chief economists are divided on AI-driven equity valuations, warn of downside risks for cryptocurrencies, see mixed prospects for gold, and expect the US dollar to weaken, a WEF survey shows.

articles.title: SEBI chair drops hints on key market reforms coming soon
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey signalled a series of changes aimed at making Indian markets more efficient and accessible. From easing processes for foreign investors to tweaks in trading systems, several reforms could be closer than expected.

articles.title: Unemployment rate rises marginally to 4.8% in December 2025
articles.summary: The overall Unemployment rate is estimated at 4.8% in December 2025 against 4.75% observed in November, according to the Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS).

articles.title: IMF's Georgieva backs Fed chair Powell, underscores importance of central bank independence
