articles.summary: The ‍probe has sparked widespread criticism from some key members of Trump's Republican Party in the US Senate, which must ‌confirm his ‌nominee to succeed Powell, along with foreign economic officials, investors and former US government officials from both political parties.

articles.title: US announces trade deal with Taiwan, cuts tariff to 15% in exchange of $250 billion investment
articles.summary: In response, the US has capped tariffs on Taiwanese auto parts, timber, lumber and wood derivative products at 15%. Generic Pharma and ingredients manufactured in Taiwan will attract zero tariff, according to the Commerce Ministry statement.

articles.title: India’s National Statistical Commission at a crossroads
articles.summary: The Parliamentary Standing Committee flags gaps in India’s National Statistical Commission, urging statutory authority, audits, and harmonisation to restore credibility and ensure reliable data for policymaking and public trust.

articles.title: India’s exports rise in first nine months of FY26, trade deficit widens beyond $25 billion
articles.summary: India’s exports grew 4.3% in April–December 2025 to $634.26 billion, led by smartphones and key markets, even as the trade deficit widened to over $25 billion.

articles.title: DEEP DIVE | Budget 2026: From housing to AI, industry flags execution gaps as the next growth challenge
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, industry leaders urge policy clarity, faster approvals, and regulatory coherence for sustainable sector growth.

articles.title: India, EU target conclusion of FTA talks within two weeks: Commerce Ministry
articles.summary: India and the European Union are in the final leg of Free Trade Agreement talks, with 20 of 24 chapters closed and negotiations underway daily in virtual mode.

articles.title: India’s merchandise exports rise 1.86% in December, overall exports up 4.33% in first nine months
articles.summary: India’s merchandise exports rose to $38.51 billion in December 2025, with strong growth in electronic goods and marine products, and record overall exports of $215.7 billion in Q3 FY26.

articles.title: Exclusive | ReNew revives US delisting plan; CEO Sumant Sinha flags challenges of staying listed
articles.summary: ReNew Energy Global may delist from NASDAQ as CPPIB and ADIA revive the take-private plan, aiming for an India listing; Masdar exited the consortium, impacting the earlier deal.

articles.title: Muthoot Microfin approves ₹200 crore secured NCD issuance, cancels ₹150 crore second tranche
articles.summary: Muthoot Microfin approved the issuance of secured, rated, listed, redeemable NCDs aggregating up to ₹200 crore on a private placement basis, with multiple series offering tenures of 24 to 36 months and coupons ranging from 9.70% to 9.95% per annum, payable monthly, and proposed to be listed on BSE.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Markets shrug off geopolitics as AI, data centres and power grids fuel a new growth cycle: Blackstone CEO
articles.summary: Stephen Schwarzman says global investors are prioritising artificial intelligence-led growth and infrastructure spending over unresolved geopolitical risks, as massive investments in data centres and power grids reshape economic momentum in the US and beyond.

articles.title: Top Stories | Davos 2026, Trump threatens tariffs on France, BCCI-Gemini deal, Rupee's new low and more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm

articles.title: M&A pipeline strongest on record, AI optimism high but risks loom for 2026: JPMorgan’s Filippo Gori
articles.summary: With financing conditions still favourable and boardroom confidence improving, global companies are stepping up dealmaking activity, even as investors weigh the opportunities and risks from artificial intelligence, inflation and geopolitics while shaping their strategies for 2026.

articles.title: Supreme Petrochem Q3 profit slumps 80% as revenue, EBITDA tumble
articles.summary: Supreme Petrochem Q3 net profit plunged 80% to ₹30.6 crore, revenue fell 66%, and shares dropped 3.48% amid business slowdown and new labour code liabilities. Shares of Supreme Petrochem ended lower on Tuesday, January 20, by 3.48% at 514.00 on the NSE.

articles.title: Pace Digitek subsidiary secures 2nd ₹94 crore order from BSNL for Li-Ion battery solutions
articles.summary: Pace Digitek’s subsidiary Lineage Power has secured a ₹94.35 crore BSNL order for 25,000 Li-Ion modules and 2,500 IP55 racks, including supply, installation, five-year warranty, and optional five-year AMC.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | After AkzoNobel deal, JSW Paints eyes top-three slot; ₹7,000-crore platform by FY26
articles.summary: With the Dulux brand now under its fold, JSW Group is preparing a major push in India’s paints market by integrating operations, expanding dealer reach and redeploying royalty savings into advertising and distribution. The company expects the JSW Paints–AkzoNobel combine to scale rapidly, improve margins and emerge as a serious challenger to the market leaders over the next few years.

articles.title: Rallis India Q3 Results | Net profit falls 5-fold on wage code provision, other parameters rise
articles.summary: Rallis India’s Q3 net profit fell 81.8% to ₹2 crore due to an exceptional gratuity provision under the wage code, despite a 19.3% rise in revenue to ₹623 crore and a 31.8% increase in EBITDA to ₹58 crore. Strong volume growth across crop care, seeds, and B2B segments supported performance, alongside new product launches and innovation milestones, including Fateh Nxt™ and patents for herbicide combinations.

articles.title: PowerGrid to procure reactors, transformers worth ₹914 crore
articles.summary: Three proposals approved for implementation within 30 months. PowerGrid shares were trading at ₹254.50 on Tuesday, down ₹3.15, or 1.22%.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | IKEA 'emotionally biased' towards India, sees long-term growth: Ingka CEO
articles.summary: Ingka Group CEO said IKEA is 'emotionally biased' towards India, where it is expanding online operations, strengthening supplier partnerships and positioning the country as a global model for sustainable and affordable growth.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Apollo Tyres eyes double-digit growth in India, to shut Netherlands plant amid Chinese imports
articles.summary: From Davos 2026, Apollo Tyres’ Vice-Chairman Neeraj Kanwar said GST cuts are boosting demand in India, with double-digit growth expected. He said Europe remains weak amid Chinese tyre imports and a Netherlands plant shutdown.

articles.title: DCM Shriram Q3 | New labour code cuts into profit; revenue rises; declares dividend
articles.summary: DCM Shriram Q3FY26 net profit fell 19% to ₹212 crore despite 13.8% revenue growth. Shares of DCM Shriram ended lower on Tuesday, January 20, by 1.96% at ₹1,110 on the NSE.

articles.title: CreditAccess Grameen Q3 | Micro lender returns to profit with a bang, NII rises 13%
articles.summary: CreditAccess Grameen posted a net profit of ₹252 crore in Q3 after last year's loss of ₹100 crore, with NII up 13% and improved collection efficiency. Branches and borrowers also increased significantly.

articles.title: Shoppers Stop Q3 Results | Profit plunges 22-fold; festive weakness, pollution leave sales flat
articles.summary: Shoppers Stop’s Q3 net profit fell sharply to ₹16.1 crore from ₹352.2 crore a year ago, while revenue grew 2.6% to ₹1,415 crore. EBITDA declined 11.1% to ₹217.8 crore, with margins dropping to 15.4% from 17.7%. Overall sales were flat due to festive calendar shifts, weak discretionary demand, and elevated pollution in North India.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Tariffs, risky geopolitics have not stopped CEOs from investing: PwC
articles.summary: PwC’s latest CEO survey shows that global business leaders are staying invested despite rising tariff risks and geopolitical uncertainty. Speaking to CNBC-TV18 from Davos 2026, PwC Global Chairman Mohamed Kande and PwC India Chairperson Sanjeev Krishan explain why capital continues to flow despite the risks.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | India now a top profit center for Saint-Gobain as expansion plan scales up
articles.summary: “In India, we have been basically doubling our size in sales every five years… and we keep investing, not only on capex with new plants, but also on acquisitions,” Bazin told CNBC-TV18

articles.title: Radisson MG Road’s LORE launch highlights rising bet on experiential dining as F&B revenues in focus
articles.summary: Radisson MG Road Delhi launched LORE, a world cuisine restaurant focused on experiential dining, reflecting F B’s rising role in hotel revenue and evolving consumer preferences in India.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | JSW's first car will launch just before Diwali this year, says Parth Jindal
articles.summary: Parth Jindal confirmed at Davos 2026 that JSW’s first car, a plug-in hybrid, will launch in India just before Diwali this year, with initial assembly of imported parts and 80% localisation of components. A second vehicle is planned for January 2027 in the ₹15–20 lakh price range.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Schneider Electric CEO highlights India focus with eye on water, hydrogen, green steel
articles.summary: Davos 2026: Gwenaelle Avice Huet of Schneider Electric highlights India’s key role in automation, water, steel, and energy, with major R D and sustainability initiatives in Delhi and global expansion plans.

articles.title: AU SFB reports strong Q3 with profit, NII up 26% & higher than expected
articles.summary: AU Small Finance Bank posted a 26.3% rise in net profit to ₹667.6 crore in Q3FY26, beating estimates, with strong NII growth and improved asset quality. Shares fell 1.93% before results.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Globalisation now a zero-sum game, warns Eswar Prasad
articles.summary: Professor of Economics at Cornell University Eswar Prasad at Davos warns of a fragile global order, declining institutional credibility, China’s internal challenges, and AI’s muted impact but potential threat to employment growth worldwide.

articles.title: Cyient DLM Q3 profit, margins widen, revenue falls; M&A cost, labour code effect dampen numbers
articles.summary: Cyient DLM reported a 2.7% year-on-year rise in Q3 net profit to ₹11.2 crore, while revenue declined 31.7% to ₹303.3 crore, impacted by completion of a large defence order. EBITDA fell 3.3% to ₹27.3 crore, but margins improved to 9% due to better revenue mix, supply chain efficiency, and operational gains.

articles.title: ‘Mother of all Deals’: Ursula von der Leyen on upcoming EU-India FTA
articles.summary: Speaking at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Ursula von der Leyen announced the EU is close to a historic free trade agreement with India, potentially creating a market of two billion people and strengthening global economic ties.

articles.title: Davos 2026: India can be one of the four main places for Siemens, says Cedrik Neike
articles.summary: Cedrik Neike of Siemens AG, speaking at WEF Davos amid global economic and geopolitical shifts, highlights India as a future industry hub with strong infrastructure and rising manufacturing,

articles.title: IndiaMART Q3 Results: Net profit rises 56% YoY, margin narrows
articles.summary: IndiaMART InterMESH Q3 FY26 net profit rose 55.6 percent to ₹188.3 crore, revenue up 13.4 percent, but EBITDA margin fell. Shares of IndiaMART InterMESH ended lower on Tuesday, January 20, by 2.37% ₹2,142.50 on the NSE.

articles.title: JioHotstar annual premium plan raised to ₹2,199, monthly packs introduced
articles.summary: JioHotstar raised its Premium annual price to ₹2,199 and added monthly plans from ₹79. Hollywood content is now in Super and Premium tiers. Existing users keep old rates if auto-renewed.

articles.title: PwC Global CEO Survey: Key takeaways on what Indian CEOs think about growth, risks, and AI
articles.summary: The PwC’s 29th Annual Global CEO Survey: India perspective shows that Indian CEOs are more optimistic about local growth, more active in expanding into new sectors, and more concerned about the speed of AI change. At the same time, many are already seeing financial benefits from using AI. Here are the main insights from the survey.

articles.title: India CEOs more confident than global peers, but increasingly wary of AI gaps and cyber risks: PwC survey
articles.summary: India CEOs show strong optimism for domestic growth and revenue, but face rising concerns over AI readiness, cybersecurity, and execution, according to PwC’s 29th Annual Global CEO Survey.

articles.title: Shadowfax sees 23-25% revenue growth as market share and value-added services expand
articles.summary: Shadowfax said its recent surge in growth was driven by higher consumption, wider digital adoption, and consolidation in the logistics sector. The company highlighted the growing contribution of value-added services such as same-day delivery and omnichannel logistics, which now form a large part of revenue and support profitability. It also said quick commerce is becoming a bigger part of its business, cash flows have turned positive, and client diversification risks have reduced as market condi

articles.title: UPL subsidiary Advanta Enterprises files IPO papers with SEBI
articles.summary: The issue will be entirely an Offer-for-Sale (OFS) of 3.61 crore equity shares, with no fresh issue component. UPL will offer 2.8 crore shares for sale in the issue.

articles.title: Cognizant plots big bets with AI, outcome-based pricing and possible India IPO
articles.summary: After stabilising its operations over the past three years, Cognizant is shifting gears toward aggressive growth strategies, with artificial intelligence and outcome-based pricing at the forefront. CEO Ravi Kumar S emphasizes the company’s evolution from a traditional IT services provider to a builder of “agentic capital,” while a potential secondary listing in India signals its intent to tap new investor pools. Strategic acquisitions and platform-led services are now central to Cognizant’s next

articles.title: Davos 2026 | GIFT City to bet on GCCs, centres of excellence for next phase of expansion: MD & Group CEO Kaul
articles.summary: GIFT City is sharpening its growth strategy as global companies look beyond banking and asset management, with global capability centres and centres of excellence emerging as the key drivers of its next expansion phase, according to Managing Director and Group CEO Sanjay Kaul at Davos.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Power, security, and enterprise readiness to define next phase of AI adoption in 2026, say tech CEOs
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence shifts from experimentation to large-scale deployment, technology leaders at Davos warn that energy constraints, cyber security risks, and the need for enterprise-grade decision systems will determine how fast and how safely AI can be adopted in 2026.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Bullish on US, India despite volatility; AI gains yet to fully play out, says Franklin Templeton CEO
articles.summary: Franklin Templeton CEO Jenny Johnson says global growth concerns and market volatility have not dimmed her confidence in the US and India, highlighting strong domestic demand, favourable demographics and the long-term potential of artificial intelligence as key drivers for investors.

articles.title: Amber Enterprises to set up new units near Jewar Airport with ₹6,785 cr investment
articles.summary: Amber Enterprises India Ltd and Ascent-K Circuit Private Ltd get land from YEIDA near Jewar Airport for new manufacturing units, investing ₹6,785 crore and creating over 3,000 jobs.

articles.title: Top Stories | Davos 2026 kicks off, Trump tariffs vs EU, IMF lifts India growth estimates & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm

articles.title: Davos 2026 | $15 bn FDI inflows validate India’s financial sector, but deposits remain the real challenge: Axis Bank CEO
articles.summary: Axis Bank CEO Amitabh Chaudhry highlighted that while foreign investors are showing renewed interest in India’s financial sector, the underlying challenge of mobilising domestic deposits remains unresolved. Speaking from Davos, he noted that inflows totaling nearly $15 billion provide strategic firepower, but real balance sheet expansion depends on building a strong deposit base—a task that requires deep local understanding and persistent effort. Chaudhry also pointed out that while foreign entr

articles.title: CNBC-TV18 Newsbreak confirmed | RBA to see new promoter as Chinese Wok owner steps in; Everstone exits fully
articles.summary: CNBC-TV18 Newsbreak confirmed: Restaurant Brands Asia will see a new promoter as Chinese Wok owner Inspira Global steps in via a ₹70-per-share preferential issue, alongside Everstone’s exit and a mandatory open offer.

articles.title: Embassy Developments announces Mumbai foray with ₹4,500 crore residential investment
articles.summary: Three projects planned across Worli, Juhu and Alibaug; launches from Q4 FY26

articles.title: Stocks to Watch for Jan 21: Persistent Systems, United Spirits, DCM Shriram and more
articles.summary: Persistent marks 23 quarters of growth but profit dips; United Spirits beats estimates; DCM Shriram profit falls; Shoppers Stop profit plunges; JSW inks deal. Here are few stocks to track ahead of Wednesday's trading session.

articles.title: HDFC Bank gets RBI nod for Kaizad Bharucha as whole-time director from April 19, 2026
articles.summary: Reserve Bank of India approves Kaizad Bharucha as whole-time director of HDFC Bank from April 19, 2026, amid changes to Infinia credit card rewards and rising shares on NSE.

articles.title: JSW Energy arm signs PPA for 1,600 MW thermal project in West Bengal
articles.summary: Greenfield plant to be set up at Salboni, West Bengal, with commissioning planned within six years; this follows a similar PPA in March, 2025.

articles.title: United Spirits Q3 profit beats estimates despite margin miss; board declares dividend
articles.summary: United Spirits reported a stronger-than-expected Q3 FY26 profit, aided by premium portfolio growth, even as margins fell short of estimates and policy headwinds weighed on select state markets.

articles.title: Trade Setup for January 21 | Nifty at a crossroads: Will the 200-DMA hold?
articles.summary: The sell-off triggered a sharp erosion of investor wealth, with the market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies shrinking by over ₹20 lakh crore so far in 2026.

articles.title: Nomura sued by Adani-linked fund accused in short-seller report
articles.summary: Some of Nomura’s most senior bankers in Asia were spooked and wanted to cut the size of the loans, according to the bank’s defence filed January 5. The Elara fund claimed that the bank requested $205 million in cash to recoup the debts but then breached a repayment plan by selling Adani shares that had been pledged as collateral — a move that resulted in losses of $43 million.

articles.title: 'Not a good time to be in equities': Chartist warns of multi-month uncertainties ahead
articles.summary: Equity markets across the globe are in risk-off mode after US President Donald Trump ramped up his tariff rhetoric again. Indian equities were not far behind, having shaved off ₹10 lakh crore in investor wealth in just Tuesday's session. Rohit Srivastava of Indiacharts warns that this could be the start of a trend reversal globally.

articles.title: Vikram Solar Q3 Results: Sharp rise in profit, margin despite labour code hit
articles.summary: Vikram Solar posted a sharp profit rise in Q3, driven by higher execution and improved margins. The company also expanded capacity to 9.5 GW and reported a robust 10.6 GW order book.

articles.title: Q3 results: J&K Bank NII dips YoY but asset quality improves
articles.summary: Jammu & Kashmir Bank Ltd posted a 10.7% rise in Q3 net profit to ₹588 crore, improved asset quality, but faced a penalty and plans to raise capital via equity and Tier 2 bonds.

articles.title: Persistent Systems Q3 revenue up, profit misses estimates as labour code weighs; dividend declared
articles.summary: Persistent Systems posted its 23rd consecutive quarter of revenue growth, with revenue rising 5.5% QoQ to ₹3,778.2 crore. Margins dipped after an ₹89 crore labour code impact, while interim dividend was declared.

articles.title: These bonds offer up to 11.15% in yields with a ₹10,000 investment
articles.summary: Investors can choose from several corporate and state-guaranteed bonds with a minimum investment of ₹10,000, offering yields between 8.7% and 11.15%. Issuers include In the Money Limited, Navi Finserv, Adani Enterprises, and state entities from Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, and Telangana, with maturities ranging from 2027 to 2030.

articles.title: Sensex, Nifty sell-off In Numbers — Summarising the ₹10 lakh crore wipe out on Tuesday
articles.summary: The Nifty 50 index has taken a pummeling in Tuesday's trading session. The index has broken below all key support levels, and is now hurtling down towards the 200-Day Moving Average, which is now placed at the 25,100 mark. Here's a look at today's trading session with the help of a few numbers.

articles.title: SRF Q3 results: Profit up 60%, beats estimates despite labour code impact; dividend declared
articles.summary: SRF posted a strong Q3 with net profit rising 60% to ₹432.7 crore and EBITDA margin at 21%, beating CNBC-TV18 polls. Shares, however, fell nearly 4% after a ₹73 crore labour code impact.

articles.title: TN Governor RN Ravi walks out of assembly, says 'was insulted, wasn't allowed to speak'
articles.summary: The Tamil Nadu Lok Bhavan alleged that the DMK government drafted address that contained “numerous unsubstantiated claims and misleading statements” while ignoring several pressing public concerns. Chief Minister MK Stalin strongly criticised the Governor RN's walkout. Read on:

articles.title: At 45, Nitin Nabin set to become BJP’s youngest president
articles.summary: BJP confirms Nabin is the only candidate in the fray; formal announcement expected on Tuesday morning, (January 20) in an event where PM Modi is expected to be present.

articles.title: Advocates cannot seek information under RTI Act for clients' cases: CIC
articles.summary: The Central Information Commission (CIC) has ruled that advocates cannot use the Right to Information (RTI) Act to seek details regarding cases they are handling for clients, observing that using the transparency law in this manner fails to advance its core objectives.

articles.title: Mumbai Mayor race heats up as Shinde camps councillors amid coalition tussle
articles.summary: Eknath Shinde moved his Shiv Sena councillors to a Bandra hotel after BMC polls, according to News18 Hindi, intensifying the Mumbai mayoral race and making his faction a key player in Mahayuti alliance negotiations.

articles.title: PM Modi to launch ₹830 cr infra push in Bengal's Singur today
articles.summary: PM Modi visits West Bengal, inaugurates projects worth over ₹830 crore in Hooghly, launches electric catamaran, new rail lines, and flags off Amrit Bharat Express trains amid BJP-TMC rivalry.

articles.title: Rahul to meet Indore water contamination victims, visit affected locality on Saturday
articles.summary: Gandhi will arrive in Indore on Saturday and meet affected persons undergoing treatment at Bombay Hospital, a private facility, he told reporters. The Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha would also visit Bhagirathpura and meet affected families to express condolences, he said.

articles.title: BJP to announce new national president on Jan 20; Nitin Nabin front-runner
articles.summary: If elected, Nabin will succeed JP Nadda, who has held the post since January 2020. Notably, Nadda had also followed a similar trajectory, having first been appointed as the BJP’s national working president in June 2019. Read on:

articles.title: BMC elections hit by removable ink row: Raj Thackeray, AAP raise concerns; poll panel to probe
articles.summary: BMC Election voting 2026: Questions are being raised over the use of marker pens instead of indelible ink in the BMC elections. The issue has sparked political backlash and fears of misuse.

articles.title: I-PAC raids: SC calls allegation of Bengal govt obstruction 'very serious' as ED seeks DGP suspension
articles.summary: ED seeks Supreme Court suspension of West Bengal DGP Rajiv Kumar over I-PAC raids, alleging police misconduct and obstruction. TMC denies charges, Assembly polls in West Bengal are approaching.

articles.title: BMC Elections 2026: Mumbai votes for 227 corporators today; know your candidates
articles.summary: Mumbai will vote for the next BMC election on January 15, 2026, after a four-year gap in the city’s civic poll cycle.

articles.title: India amends motor vehicle rules: No NOC, fitness renewal or permits if toll dues pending
articles.summary: The Government of India has amended the Motor Vehicles Rules to block NOCs, fitness renewals and national permits for vehicles with unpaid tolls logged in the Electronic Toll Collection system.

articles.title: Delhi air quality: GRAP Stage‑IV revoked as AQI improves; Stage I–III curbs to stay
articles.summary: CAQM lifts GRAP Stage-IV curbs in Delhi after AQI improves to 378, but Stage-I, II and III restrictions remain. Agencies to intensify monitoring as winter may worsen air quality.

articles.title: Republic Day Long Weekend: Last-minute getaways from Delhi, Mumbai, and other major cities
articles.summary: The Republic Day long weekend is a good chance to take a short break without using many leave days. For those who have not planned ahead, there are still several destinations close to major cities that are easy to reach and do not need detailed planning. Here are some last-minute travel ideas from major Indian cities that can be covered comfortably in two or three days.

articles.title: WEF 2026: Andhra Pradesh to announce new investments over next 90 days, says Nara Lokesh
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh IT minister Nara Lokesh said Andhra Pradesh is focusing on building full industrial ecosystems, combining land, skilled workforce, testing facilities and certification infrastructure. He said the state already accounts for about 50% of India’s air-conditioner manufacturing and expects this to rise to 70% after recent deals.

articles.title: Tata Motors launches 17 trucks, expands EV range and adopts latest European crash norms
articles.summary: Tata Motors has rolled out 17 next-generation trucks across 7–55 tonnes in India, introducing the Azura range, its Tata Trucks.ev portfolio and cabs compliant with stringent European crash safety norms for safer logistics.

articles.title: Innovate and Evolve – Liebherr: Engineering refrigeration for Indian homes
articles.summary: As Indian homes become more design-focused and performance-driven, refrigerators have evolved into a blend of engineering, lifestyle, and long-term reliability. The key question now is not what a refrigerator does, but how well it is built for Indian conditions. This is the larger context explored through Innovate & Evolve, presented by Network18 and powered by Liebherr.

articles.title: Nitin Nabin is new BJP national president, PM Modi calls him 'boss'
articles.summary: Nitin Nabin, aged 45, was elected as the new national president of Bharatiya Janata Party, succeeding Jagat Prakash Nadda, with PM Modi and senior leaders present at the Delhi headquarters.

articles.title: Mysterious ‘boiling’ water reported in Arabian Sea near Gujarat coast, probe on
articles.summary: The Palghar Disaster Management Cell is currently working with marine officials to investigate if the churning is caused by natural geological shifts or a human-caused industrial accident.

articles.title: Skoda reveals Kushaq facelift in India with standard electric sunroof, new 8-speed AT
articles.summary: Skoda Auto India has unveiled the Kushaq facelift ahead of prices and opened bookings for its updated mid-size SUV, with a standard electric sunroof and a new eight-speed automatic gearbox.

articles.title: IKEA debuts in Tamil Nadu with online delivery starting January 22
articles.summary: The move comes as the company noted strong enthusiasm from the state as spotted through online searches and social media sentiment among other things.

articles.title: India, EU set to conclude Free Trade Deal by Jan 27
articles.summary: Negotiators have struck a balance on sensitive areas with agriculture and dairy sectors respecting both sides’ red lines, while the EU has agreed to provide greater market access for Indian labour-intensive exports.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh CM N. Chandrababu Naidu confirms new spaceport at Hope Island for private launch missions
articles.summary: The site is expected to primarily support private launch providers, adding to India’s expanding launch infrastructure.

articles.title: Toyota enters India’s EV race with Urban Cruiser Ebella: 61 kWh battery, 543 km range and Level 2 ADAS
articles.summary: Toyota India has unveiled the Urban Cruiser Ebella EV, its first electric SUV for the country, offering 49 kWh and 61 kWh LFP battery options, up to 543 km ARAI range, Level 2 ADAS, seven airbags, and a battery-as-a-service programme ahead of pricing.

articles.title: INS Sudarshini to embark on Lokayan 26, covering 18 ports in 13 countries
articles.summary: The Indian Navy’s sail training ship INS Sudarshini will begin the sailing on January 20. The voyage will see the ship visit 18 foreign ports in 13 countries – making it one of the Indian Navy’s most extensive sail training deployments in recent years.

articles.title: Rare historic solar radiation storm hits Earth after two decades, Aurora displays likely
articles.summary: According to US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), sustained or intensifying G4 conditions could cause the auroral oval to expand significantly, potentially making the northern lights visible across much of the United States. Read on:

articles.title: Sabrimala gold loss case: ED searches 21 locations across three states
articles.summary: Enforcement Directorate raided 21 locations in Kerala, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu over the Sabarimala gold loss case, investigating gold misappropriation from Lord Ayyappa shrine artefacts.

articles.title: Republic Day 2026: Centre plans Vande Mataram theme as EU leaders visit India for parade and trade talks
articles.summary: The Centre plans a Vande Mataram theme for Republic Day as EU leaders visit India, with a parade, cultural events and an EU-India summit scheduled next day.

articles.title: Govt to demolish Shastri and Krishi Bhawans, invites bids for new ₹3,000 crore buildings
articles.summary: The new Buildings 4 and 5 will each have eight floors and will be constructed as PEB steel structures, including a basement, ground floor, seven upper storeys, and a terrace. Read more:

articles.title: Noida techie death case: CM Yogi orders SIT probe, CEO removed; safety audit across UP
articles.summary: Following the directions of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, senior IAS officer Lokesh M was removed from the post of Noida Authority CEO. FIRs have been filed and the SIT has been asked to submit its report. Read on:

articles.title: Karnataka DGP Ramachandra Rao suspended over inappropriate viral video
articles.summary: Karnataka suspended DGP K Ramachandra Rao after a viral video allegedly showed him in a compromising position. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah ordered a probe. Rao denies the allegations.

articles.title: Maharashtra secures MoUs worth over $50 billion at WEF in Davos
articles.summary: The highest commitment came from Alta Capital together with Panchshil Realty, who signed an agreement proposing $25 billion investment that could generate up to 250,000 jobs.

articles.title: Delhi-NCR chokes as air quality remains 'severe' amid dense fog
articles.summary: Only 38 out of 40 pollution monitoring stations in Delhi were functioning and almost all of them recorded air quality in the severe range. Only NSIT Dwarka (300) recorded AQI in the moderate range. Read on:

articles.title: Certain power supply from more forms of renewable energy, battery storage needed to cut emissions: Expert
articles.summary: Debate over pollution sources, thermal power role and clean energy transition sharpens amid prolonged poor air quality.

articles.title: President Droupadi Murmu shares a glimpse of the 77th Republic Day At-Home invitation | Watch
articles.summary: Sharing a short film of the invitation kit on X, President Murmu highlighted that it celebrates the living traditions of India’s North-Eastern Region.

articles.title: Republic Day 2026: Kartavya Path parade spots renamed after Indian rivers to eliminate 'VIP culture' labels
articles.summary: Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh revealed that all enclosures along the parade route will have the names of rivers, including the Ganga, Yamuna, Brahmaputra, Narmada, Godavari, Cauvery, Ghagra, Sindhu, Jhelum, Pennar, Ravi, Sone, Sutlej, and many more.

articles.title: PM Modi receives UAE President Mohamed bin Zayed on brief India visit
articles.summary: Trade, investment, defence cooperation and Middle East situation set to figure in talks

articles.title: Power Minister: One big country was staring at us, now started staring at European countries
articles.summary: Without naming any country, the Minister asked till when this will staring continue.

articles.title: Supreme Court pulls up Madhya Pradesh for delay in sanction to prosecute Minister Kunwar Shah
articles.summary: The Supreme Court questioned the MP government over its delay in granting sanction to prosecute minister Kunwar Vijay Shah, months after an SIT sought approval for remarks made against Colonel Sofiya Qureshi.

articles.title: Unnao rape: Delhi HC refuses to suspend Kuldeep Singh Sengar's 10-year sentence
articles.summary: Delhi High Court refused to suspend Kuldeep Singh Sengar's 10-year sentence for the Unnao rape survivor's father's death in custody, listing the appeal for hearing on February 3.

articles.title: India to table Electricity Amendment Bill in budget session of Parliament
articles.summary: The government is preparing to introduce the Electricity Amendment Bill in the Budget Session of Parliament after a two-day Chintan Shivir with states, even as Power Minister Manohar Lal Khattar ruled out any shift in market coupling policy.

articles.title: Republic Day 2026: Extensive security measures and airspace restrictions in place ahead of Jan 26
articles.summary: As security arrangements are intensified, flight operations at the Indira Gandhi International Airport will face daily suspensions of nearly two-and-a-half hours between January 21 and January 26.

articles.title: Electronics industry flags budget gap: 0% tax on machines and 15% on parts pushes imports from China
